column4: I'm having an issue, I have two boxes with Dapper Drake, one with a SB Audigy card (working fine) and one with a SB Live! (no sound) Any idea how to get it working?
Yes, there is an OSS onboard and no way to disable.
OSS doesn't install either, that's why I installed the SB Live! knowing Linux's compatibility with Creative cards.
I have never seen an onboard sound card that count not be disabled
could
It doesn't show up in Device Manager and mixer says Gstreamer no cards.
First one I've seen too, this is a Compaq Presario 5192.
IN rare cases I had to move a jumper on the mb
I didn't even bother looking at a hardware interrupt... that's probably it.
Default sound card: (Blank dropdown.
No return, back to prompt, do I need to su first?
I just plugged in a Logitech USB Headset (Playstation 2)...
FATAL: Module emu10k1 not found.
The Logitech works, and shows up in System/Preferance/Sound.
No return.
That's the point.
grepping emu10k1 or snd-emu10k1 from a lsmod returns nothing.
It seems like a hardware detection problem not a driver issue...
Unfortunately I can't verify that the BIOS sees the card, it's a junky BIOS.
Once again, no return.

Using this compaq page it says you can disable onboard sound  http://h10025.www1.hp.com/ewfrf/wc/document?lc=en&cc=us&dlc=en&tool=prodinfoCategory&product=93128&dest_page=prodinfoCategory&docname=bph07110#N1003
